Class BlockRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.render.BlockRenderer
public class BlockRenderer extends Object
Helper class for rendering blocks to different containers. Handles drawing falling blocks, ghost blocks, and preview blocks.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    BlockRenderer.BlockStyle
    Enum for different block rendering styles.

  • Constructor Details

      public BlockRenderer()

  • Method Details

    • renderToGridPane

      public void renderToGridPane(int[][] shape, int xPos, int yPos, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, List<javafx.scene.Node> nodeList, BlockRenderer.BlockStyle style)
      Renders a block to a GridPane (for falling blocks and ghost blocks on the game board).
      Parameters:
      shape - The block shape data (2D array)
      xPos - The X position on the board
      yPos - The Y position on the board
      gridPane - The GridPane to render to
      nodeList - List to store the created nodes (for later removal)
      style - The rendering style (NORMAL or GHOST)

    • renderToPane

      public void renderToPane(int[][] shape, javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, BlockRenderer.BlockStyle style)
      Renders a block to a Pane (for preview blocks like next blocks and hold block).
      Parameters:
      shape - The block shape data (2D array)
      pane - The Pane to render to
      style - The rendering style (should be PREVIEW)

    • getFillColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Paint getFillColor(int i)
      Gets the fill color for a given color code. Public static method for use in other classes (e.g., for background rendering).

    • getBorderColor

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Color getBorderColor(int i)
      Gets the border color for a given color code. Public static method for use in other classes (e.g., for background rendering).

    • initializeGhostManagement

      public void initializeGhostManagement(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
      Initializes ghost block management with the GridPane to render to. Must be called before using ghost block methods.
      Parameters:
      gridPane - The GridPane where ghost blocks will be rendered

    • drawGhost

      public void drawGhost(Block block, int xPos, int ghostY)
      Draws a ghost piece (outline with dotted border) showing where the block will land. Automatically clears any existing ghost before drawing the new one.
      Parameters:
      block - The block shape to draw
      xPos - The X position of the block
      ghostY - The Y position where the ghost should appear (calculated landing position)

    • clearGhost

      public void clearGhost()
      Clears the ghost piece from the display.
